actions.recommendation: Limit foods high in saturated & trans fats, such as full cream items, red meat & fried foods. Add fish, seeds and whole grains to your diet. Supplements like Rychol can help lower cholesterol levels. Repeat these blood tests in 3-6 months.
Limit the sugar intake in your food & drinks. Opt for fresh fruit instead. Preparing your meals in advance may help you make better food choices.
Exercise moderately for at least 30 minutes 3-5x a week.
Maintain your BMI between 18.5 - 24.9 and waist to height ratio below 50. This decreases your risk of developing lifestyle diseases such as hypertension and diabetes.
Strength training will help you burn fat, build muscle and improve your cholesterol.
Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologist for a Pap smear.
